sen.j: 資宗は順調に出世し、徳川家光からの覚えも良く、六人衆（のちの若年寄）となり、さらには下野国山川藩15600石の藩主となる。
sen.e: Sukemune who had been smoothly promoted and favored by Iemitsu TOKUGAWA was assigned for Rokuninshu (later, Wakadoshiyori (a managerial position in Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun))) and became a head of Yamakawa Domain, Shimotsuke Province which yielded 15,600 koku in rice.

sen.j: 奏者番などを歴任し、最終的には遠江国浜松藩35000石まで登りつめ、子孫は幕府の要職を歴任し、老中も出し、明治維新後には子爵となった。
sen.e: After Sukemune continued to take the posts of Sojaban (an official in charge of ceremonies,) etc., he finally rose to the head of Totoumi Domain, Hamamatsu Province which yielded 35,000 koku in rice, and his offspring continued to take important posts in the bakufu such as Roju (a member of shogun's council of elders) and became a viscount after the Meiji Restoration.

sen.e: The temple, which had been under the aegis of Yorifusa TOKUGAWA and Iemitsu TOKUGAWA and initially founded with 玉蜂清因 (Sarahime, a daughter of Yorifusa TOKUGAWA) in the post of chief priest, continued to invite daughters from Mito Tokugawa family for the chief priest post, and therefore it seemed to be called 'Mito Goten Palace' or 'nunnery temple in Mito.'
